org.fluidity.testing

Interface Simulator.Threads

  • Enclosing class:
    Simulator

    public static interface Simulator.Threads
    Allows test cases to manage interacting threads. Threads are created by the concurrent() method and started / stopped by the verify(long, Simulator.Task), verify(long, Simulator.Work), guarantee(long, Simulator.Task), or guarantee(long, Simulator.Work) method.

    Threads synchronize on barriers using the lineup() method and relative time can be given using time(float).

    Usage

     @Test
 public void testConcurrency() throws Exception {
   final Threads threads = newThreads("Concurrency");

   // barrier initialized with number of threads to synchronize on:
   final CyclicBarrier barrier = new CyclicBarrier(2);

   …

   threads.concurrent(new Task.Concurrent() {
     public Task run(final MockObjects factory) throws Exception {
       return new Task() {
         public void run() throws Exception {
           …
           thread.lineup(barrier, threads.time(10));
           …
           thread.lineup(barrier, threads.time(10));
           …
         }
       }
     }
   });

   …

   threads.verify(threads.time(30), new Task() {
     public void run() throws Exception {
       …
       thread.lineup(barrier, threads.time(10));
       …
       thread.lineup(barrier, threads.time(10));
       …
     }
   });
 }

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String TIMING_BASE
      The system variable that forms the base value used for adjusting thread synchronization timing.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void concurrent(Simulator.Task.Concurrent task)
      Creates a new thread to execute a concurrent task with, and a new Simulator.MockObjects to create mock objects with for use by the concurrent task.
      void guarantee(long timeout, Simulator.Task task)
      Releases all threads created by concurrent(Simulator.Task.Concurrent), invokes Simulator.guarantee(Simulator.Task), and then waits, with the given timeout, for all threads to complete.
      <T> T guarantee(long timeout, Simulator.Work<T> block)
      Releases all threads created by concurrent(Simulator.Task.Concurrent), invokes Simulator.guarantee(Simulator.Work), waits, for the given timeout, for all threads to complete, and returns whatever the block returned.
      int lineup(CyclicBarrier barrier, long timeout)
      Causes all threads calling the same method with the same barrier to synchronize at the point of calling this method.
      void serial(Simulator.Task task)
      Executes in the calling thread the given task.
      long time(float factor)
      Returns an adjusted value to be used for timing.
      void verify(long timeout, Simulator.Task task)
      Releases all threads created by concurrent(Simulator.Task.Concurrent), invokes Simulator.verify(Simulator.Task), and then waits, for the given timeout, for all threads to complete.
      <T> T verify(long timeout, Simulator.Work<T> block)
      Releases all threads created by concurrent(Simulator.Task.Concurrent), invokes Simulator.verify(Simulator.Work), waits, for the given timeout, for all threads to complete, and returns whatever the block returned.

    • Field Detail

      • TIMING_BASE

        static final String TIMING_BASE
        The system variable that forms the base value used for adjusting thread synchronization timing. The default base value is 10 ms.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • time

        long time(float factor)
        Returns an adjusted value to be used for timing. The value can be adjusted by the TIMING_BASE system variable.
        Parameters:
        factor - the time in milliseconds to adjust.
        Returns:
        the adjusted time value.

      • serial

        void serial(Simulator.Task task)
     throws Exception
        Executes in the calling thread the given task. This method is merely a visual aid to separate the execution of the task from other code sequences.

        This method may be invoked from a task submitted to concurrent(Simulator.Task.Concurrent).

        Parameters:
        task - the task to execute; if null, no code is executed between the two barriers, if any.
        Throws:
        Exception - whatever the task throws.

      • concurrent

        void concurrent(Simulator.Task.Concurrent task)
         throws Exception
        Creates a new thread to execute a concurrent task with, and a new Simulator.MockObjects to create mock objects with for use by the concurrent task. The specified task creates and sets up mock objects and returns a Simulator.Task that uses those mock objects.

        This method may not be invoked from a task submitted to another invocation of the concurrent(...), verify(...), or guarantee(...) methods.

        Parameters:
        task - the task to execute in a new thread.
        Throws:
        Exception - whatever the task throws.

      • lineup

        int lineup(CyclicBarrier barrier,
           long timeout)
    throws Exception
        Causes all threads calling the same method with the same barrier to synchronize at the point of calling this method. Invocations of method must be accompanied with CyclicBarrier.getParties() number of invocation in all different threads with the same barrier for the caller threads to pass the call without error.
        Parameters:
        barrier - the barrier to synchronize on.
        timeout - the maximum time to wait for other threads to coalesce.
        Returns:
        the arrival index of the calling thread.
        Throws:
        Exception - when something goes wrong during synchronization.

      • verify

        void verify(long timeout,
            Simulator.Task task)
     throws Exception
        Releases all threads created by concurrent(Simulator.Task.Concurrent), invokes Simulator.verify(Simulator.Task), and then waits, for the given timeout, for all threads to complete.

        This method may not be invoked from a task submitted to concurrent(Simulator.Task.Concurrent).

        Parameters:
        timeout - the timeout to wait for all threads to complete.
        task - the task to verify.
        Throws:
        Exception - whatever the task throws.

      • guarantee

        void guarantee(long timeout,
               Simulator.Task task)
        throws Exception
        Releases all threads created by concurrent(Simulator.Task.Concurrent), invokes Simulator.guarantee(Simulator.Task), and then waits, with the given timeout, for all threads to complete.

        This method may not be invoked from a task submitted to concurrent(Simulator.Task.Concurrent).

        Parameters:
        timeout - the timeout to wait for all threads to complete.
        task - the task to verify.
        Throws:
        Exception - whatever the task throws.

      • verify

        <T> T verify(long timeout,
             Simulator.Work<T> block)
      throws Exception
        Releases all threads created by concurrent(Simulator.Task.Concurrent), invokes Simulator.verify(Simulator.Work), waits, for the given timeout, for all threads to complete, and returns whatever the block returned.

        This method may not be invoked from a block submitted to concurrent(Simulator.Task.Concurrent).

        Type Parameters:
        T - the type returned by the block.
        Parameters:
        timeout - the timeout to wait for all threads to complete.
        block - the block containing the calls to verify.
        Returns:
        whatever the task returns.
        Throws:
        Exception - whatever the task throws.

      • guarantee

        <T> T guarantee(long timeout,
                Simulator.Work<T> block)
         throws Exception
        Releases all threads created by concurrent(Simulator.Task.Concurrent), invokes Simulator.guarantee(Simulator.Work), waits, for the given timeout, for all threads to complete, and returns whatever the block returned.

        This method may not be invoked from a block submitted to concurrent(Simulator.Task.Concurrent).

        Type Parameters:
        T - the type returned by the block.
        Parameters:
        timeout - the timeout to wait for all threads to complete.
        block - the block containing the calls to verify.
        Returns:
        whatever the block returns.
        Throws:
        Exception - whatever the block throws.
